qas.question: What was the historical range of the whooping crane?

answers.text: central Canada South to Mexico, and from Utah to the Atlantic coast

qas.question: What two issues caused steady decline in the whooping crane population?
What was the estimated population of the whooping crane in 1941?
How many years after the noted absence of the whooping crane from its breeding range did the first law regulating wildlife commerce pass
What species is found ranging from Canada to Utah?
How many years did it take for the whooping crane to disappear?
How many whooping cranes were there in 1890?
What year did the whooping crane begin to get attention?

context: One species in particular received widespread attention—the <b4_0>whooping crane<b4_0/>. The species' historical range extended from <a0_0>central Canada South to Mexico, and from Utah to the Atlantic coast<a0_0/>. <a1_0>Unregulated hunting and habitat loss<a1_0/> contributed to a steady decline in the whooping crane population until, by <b8_0>1890<b8_0/>, it had disappeared from its primary breeding range in the north central United States. It would be another <a3_0><b5_0>eight<b5_0/> years<a3_0/> before the first national law regulating wildlife commerce was signed, and another two years before the first version of <b7_0>the endangered species act<b7_0/> was passed. The whooping crane population by 1941 was estimated at about only <a2_0><b6_0>16<b6_0/> birds<a2_0/> still in the wild.
